items.content_html:
Fixes #30256

The text in the options parameters is correc (it comes from the spec: https://streams.spec.whatwg.org/#rs-prototype) but wrong because it is in the wrong place.

Specifically it stated for each option "In this case the method will" but if you read the "case" as the value being either false or true the text is incorrect.

I have moved the information about what happens down to the return value, as a description of the errors.
items.title: ReadableStream.pipeThrough - fix confusing text

items.title: browser_action mandatory properties correction on toolbar button page

items.content_html:
Summary

The statement I propose to be removed on line 69 i.e "sent from server to client" indicates that packets are only sent to the client. Yet, servers also receive packets from clients.

Changes

So I changed some content of line 69 from "sent from server to client" to "transfered between the client and server"

Motivation

I thought it is important to clarify this because we have a reasonable number of beginners using MDN.

Additional details

You can get more context here: https://chat.openai.com/share/e875af6c-d468-4174-9740-0f869e229047
items.title: Update index.md

items.content_html:
…"When they accept the prompt..."

Fixed typo: From "When the accept the prompt..." to "When they accept the prompt..."

Description

Fixed typo: From "When the accept the prompt..." to "When they accept the prompt..."

Motivation

While reading and learning myself, it bothered me when I had to re-read the sentence 3 times and mentally fix it, breaking my sense of concentration going through the tutorial.

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: Update index.md: Fixed typo: From "When the accept the prompt..." to …

items.content_html:
This is a website that surveys which extensions are actually supported in the wild: https://web3dsurvey.com

Description

This is a website that I created earlier this year. It is included on a number of prominent WebGL related websites including webglfundamentals.org, threejs and modelviewer.dev. It aggregates the results in the various reports you see.

This helps users determine which extensions they can use safely and which are more optional. It is a survey of just the last 2 weeks of data, so it is very current.

The website also links back to the MDN docs for most official extensions.

Motivation

This makes WebGL developer live's easier since they know what is and isn't supported in the wild.

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: "Using WebGL extensions" - add  https://web3dsurvey.com

Description

Added the missing part to the docs where the caller side is handling the answer message it receives from the callee side.

Motivation

This piece is important, it is present in illustrations featured earlier in the article, and is present in the sample server as well, but it was left out from the code section of the article, which might lead readers to believe that it isn't required.

Additional details

Here is the illustration that I am referring to, which shows this as the last step.

items.title: Add handling of answer message on the caller side

items.content_html:
"@import url(C.css);" does not create an unnamed layer, but appends to the implicit layer of unlayered styles.

Description

Fixed an inaccuracy: using "@import url(C.css);" doesn't create a new unamed layer. but appends the C.css styles into the final unlayered layer styles.

Motivation

Fix an inaccuracy on the docs.

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: fix inaccuracy section "in Precedence order of regular cascade layers"

items.content_html:
Adds a remark early on regarding scope rules, and adds an example of registering a service worker with a broadened scope.

Description

Adds a remark on the possibility of scope broadening in the first paragraph on setting the scope manually.
The previous text made it seem like this wasn't possible, only to be counteracted a couple of paragraphs later.
Also adds an example of scope broadening, specifying failure or success conditions based on the Service-Worker-Allowed header.

Motivation

The previous text was confusing. I've had colleagues ask me about the scope rules citing it cannot be broadened
after skimming the article.

Related issues and pull requests

Fixes #30306
items.title: Clarifies scope broadening, fixing #30306

items.title: Fix a small grammatical error

items.content_html:
Description

move the KeyboardEvent.locale property description in KeyboardEvent interface to Obsolete properties section

i. the property does not have its browser compat data, see https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/KeyboardEvent
ii. it is not a part of the standard, see https://w3c.github.io/uievents/#keyboardevent (it is in earlier standard but has been removed yet)
iii. major browsers do not add the property (I test for chrome and firefox), also see https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=168971 and https://bugs.webkit.org/show_bug.cgi?id=69029

also, update the order of sections and remove the description of UIEvent.which property which is inherits from UIEvent interface

Motivation

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: update `KeyboardEvent` interface

items.content_html:
#30132 contains the engineering technical review for my work on the @scope docs, which has been completed and approved. Thank you to @bramus and @ramiy for you review work.

This is a new PR based on the same branch, which is intended to contain the editorial review for the same work.

Background information

The @scope at-rule was shipped in Chrome 118 (see https://chromestatus.com/feature/5100672734199808). @ramiy very kindly created a first pass at the @scope reference page. This PR builds on that, adding further details and making some related changes to other existing pages.

Specifically, this PR:

  • Updates the @scope page.
  • Adds reference pages for CSSScopeRule and its end and start properties.
  • Updates the :scope reference page to add information about @scope, and provide better examples.
  • Updates all the CSS cascade-related pages on MDN to include appropriate mentions of @scope, as listed in #17751. I didn't update the skills test live example because it seemed a bit out of scope. There are many aspects of the cascade that are not tested on that page; it doesn't feel like adding a @scope example is a requirement of my work here.

Motivation

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests

Fixes #17751
items.title: feat: Editorial review for @scope docs

items.content_html:
Description

the uninitialized is a valid value for DataTransfer.effectAllowed and is the initial value if it is not set yet, the documentation there behave like if the uninitialized is not a valid value and is simply a state that represent as all value

also fix some spell and make some style update

Motivation

Additional details

Working on https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTML_Drag_and_Drop_API/Drag_operations

reference to https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/dnd.html#dom-datatransfer-effectallowed and https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DataTransfer/effectAllowed

Related issues and pull requests
